message: Hello You? How dare you show your face?
Hello You? How dare you show your face?
You betrayed the Guild over the task with Defy. Get out!
Hi there. I am Nanath. No need to introduce yourself, I know who you are, $playername.

replies.text: Oh. Hi Nanath. You look scared.

message: Well, one of our ex-clients, Lady Dameni, has put an adverse Shadow spell on us.
It makes us noticeable, and thus vulnerable to being caught - paralyzing our honest bread and butter work.
Umar wants me to handle it. He wants me to get it dispelled, so that Thieves' Guild can work again.
The thing is I don't know much about the Shadow or any other so-called powers. My life has been being an honest thief, a score here, a score there - I don't tangle with the supernatural stuff.
Can't anyone help?

replies.text: I can help. I've had some dealings with the Shadow.

message: Really? Like what?

replies.text: Sorry, hush-hush stuff around Loneford and Vilegard.

message: Of course.
First things first, how can we know the nature of the spell?
Or its name?
Maybe talking to a Shadow priest may help?

replies.text: I'll see what I can do.

message: Oh, back again? I hope you bring good news.

replies.text: Talion, Shadow priest, has put it on us after all - the Striking Spectacle Shadow spell.
I have been looking for the things for Talion.
I am still looking for Seraphina.

message: And?

replies.text: And ... I think I have to talk to Talion again.
Talion said, he can help dispel it.

message: What a relief.
What does he want in return?

replies.text: Lady Dameni paid him. Talion wants 50000 coins to dispel us.

message: That's a lot, but it was to be expected. It's good that he doesn't want more.

replies.text: Well ... he also wants the following items: The Villain's ring, Troublemaker's ring, the ring of backstabbing and the Tears of the Shadow potion.

message: That's fine with me.
What?! He must be crazy!
Do you have all of the items already?

replies.text: I don't have Troublemaker's ring yet.
I don't have the ring of backstabbing yet.
I don't have the Villain's ring yet.
I don't have the Tears of the Shadow yet.
I have bought the 4 easier things already.

message: Well, then go and find these thing. Hurry now!
Good, that's a start.

replies.text: I expect to be reimbursed of course.

message: Umar will refund - only if you succeed.
Have you found Luthor's ring already?

replies.text: I am looking for it now.
I have no idea where to look any more.

message: Looks like it ended up being kept somewhere dangerous.
Then ... only one person may know: Sly Seraphina.

replies.text: On no! Not her! I refuse to talk to her.

message: She's the thief near the Sutdover bridge.

replies.text: Sutdover bridge? So I'll look for her to the south.

message: You must. For the Guild!

replies.text: All right, I hate to, but for the greater good I'll go.

message: Then it's all settled. Go and find her, now.
Then go and find her, now.
How progresses the task? Hope you've done it? We're in a pickle here, kid. No time to dawdle.

replies.text: Dawdle! Do it yourself if you know everything better!

message: Calm down. I'm just nervous. Did you make any progress?
Tell me.

replies.text: Seraphina has disappeared. She's scared to unleash some monsters which she says Umar and her sealed up.

message: She must. Tell her this password [whispering something]. It means you have direct order from Umar. Let no one else hear it.
So, that's what Umar is hush-hush about.

replies.text: He could really be more talkative sometimes.

message: Anyway, we must find her. I know some of her usual hidings.
She prefers to be close to a town so she can easily stock up.
Let me think: Fallhaven would be too near. Sullengard, Stoutford, Vilegard and Prim come to my mind. And Loneford or Brimhaven, of course.
So look for her near one of these towns.

replies.text: Which towns did you say again?

message: Sometimes I could despair. It's so hard to find good workers these days.
She must be found. By all means.
Have you found Seraphina yet?

replies.text: Yes. She told me I would need Luthor's key.
Yes. She told me I would need Luthor's key.

message: I already thought so and asked it from Umar. Here you have it, handle it carefully.
I have given it to you already, forgotten?

replies.text: Oh, right. I'm ashamed of myself for trying to trick you.

message: I truly hope you are.
Hi kid.
Then bring it to Talion. Quickly.
You were obviously successful. We seem to be inconspicuous again.
Good job! Didn't think you could do it. But you did.

replies.text: Yes. The search was a nice change.

message: Umar asked me to reimburse you for your expenses. And something as a thank you. So here are 75000 shining pieces of gold.
Stay safe, kid.
Hello $playername, good that you are here. Please talk to Nanath, I am really busy right now.
Excuse me? I don't know what you want from me.
Umar? Who's that?

replies.text: Oh well: I am nothing. You don't see me.

message: That's better, little child. Get used to it.

replies.text: I'm not a little child anymore!

message: Then stop stomping on the ground.
Now what does Umar want?

replies.text: We have to remove the Striking Spectacle Shadow spell from members of the Thieves' Guild. Or the Guild may as well cease to exist.

message: And what do I have to do with it?

replies.text: We need Luthor's ring, and you know ...

message: Likely story, kid. Buzz off!
Now what does Umar want?

replies.text: We have to remove the Striking Spectacle Shadow spell from ...

message: Yes, you've said already. Stop repeating yourself.

replies.text: Sure. We need Luthor's ring, and ...

message: Forget it, kid. Buzz off!

replies.text: Sure. We need Luthor's ring, and ...

message: And please, stop repeating yourself.
Now what does Umar want?

replies.text: Listen ... [whispering the password] Now you believe me? We have to remove the Striking Spectacle ...

message: You are still repeating yourself.

replies.text: Stop that game now and answer me!

message: All right. Umar wants me to give you Luthor's ring? And unleash evil on the Dhayavar?

replies.text: Why would that ring unleash evil?

message: Not the ring itself. But the cave does, if the door is opened.

replies.text: That makes even less sense. Explain.

message: Say 'please'.
You might remember Crackshot's hideout, do you?

replies.text: Of course. Behind the many ugly larvals.

message: Good. Do you know why that cave in the back was sealed?
A while back, when the Thieves' Guild got successful, we managed to acquire many items of value, including magical items.
A place was needed to keep them safely. We heard of this deep cave where you met and bested Crackshot.
So, when we created that deep cave hideout for our most precious items, we never imagined that the cave held such terrible monsters. While we were exploring, they came and attacked us!
Seraphina suddenly shivers.
We're thieves, not warriors. We tried to escape from there. Lost a few members ...
Lost Luthor's ring in the cave in the scramble to get out.
Still, we managed to hold off the cave monsters, and we managed to seal it.
That's right!
We used Luthor's Key and his gloves to seal it, by creating a magical, impermeable door.
Umar and I decided to separate the key and the gloves. And both of us we never meet, to keep that door permanently sealed.

replies.text: So that the door may never be opened.

message: Exactly.

replies.text: But we need to retrieve Luthor's ring now.

message: Even Umar's current plea will not change my mind. Whatever ails the Guild - do find another solution.
*** Debug version, remove befor publish ***

*** Hint for debug version: Brimhaven
*** Press Next

*** Hint for debug version: Vilegard
*** Press Next
Even us thieves are not so callous as to put Dhayavar in danger. You'll never find me.
Watch out, kid. Behind you!
Ok, you're tough, even if not smart, kid.
Smart enough to find me, and tough enough to beat my friends. You convinced me that we can do it.
Like we talked, Luthor's Ring can be found in the secret room which Crackshot tried to open with Luthor's key from Umar.
So you have to go and ask Umar for Luthor's key.
However, that door can only be opened if you also wear Luthor's gloves, which breaks the spell on it.

replies.text: And the evil you mentioned are monsters, nothing more?

message: In fact, I didn't take the time to look at them more closely. But they seemed terrible and deadly to me.
When the door opens, and these strong monsters escape into the open, they will attack Dhayavar, which we must avoid at all costs.
Which reminds me: Another kid was looking for information to open it.

replies.text: That kid, did he look just like me, but older?

message: Come to think of it, he did.

replies.text: [to self] What was Andor trying to do now?

message: Looking at your strength, kid, you may just be able to beat those monsters. We might give it a try.
By the way, here's your money back. 1000 gold pieces.
Meet me at the door to the secret room and bring Luthor's key. Together with Luthor's gloves the door will open.
What did you expect?
OK, I admit that you are quite fine.
I would actually do a job with you again if the opportunity came up.
And now buzz off, kid. ... $playername.
See you.
At last! Did you sleep all the way long?
Give me Luthor's key now.

replies.text: Haha, funny. I forgot to bring it.
Here it is. Let's do it.

message: Seraphina stares at you in disbelief.

replies.text: Eh, I'm getting it, I'm running. Just a minute ...

message: Don't you dare to come back without!
Seraphina takes the key and easily unlocks the door. As quick as a weasel, she slips into the dark corridor.
Hey kid, stay close behind me! It's going to be dangerous.
Ha! Take that, skeleton!
Just one more hit ...
Finished. Take a quick breather and then move on to the next one ...
And keep staying close behind me!
Bang!!
Bang again!!
Pew, it's getting warm. Oh, now there are three of them ...
Stay close to me!
Ha! Move, you lazy bones!
Ouch! That has hurt.
Aaargh!!
Noo! I can't ... Help! I'm wounded ... Run!
With her last bit of strength, Seraphina leapt past you and fell to the ground.
I'm OK again! I'll help in the search.
Don't push me. I need to concentrate.
Help ... don't let me die here ...
[weak voice] ... help me ...
It's good to ... see you are alive, kid.
Nice compliment, kid. Ooouw ...
Yes, thanks to you. Just give me a few seconds ...
Give me some healing potion ... please ...

replies.text: Here, have a minor vial of health.
Here, have a minor vial of health.
Here, have a potion of health.
Here, have a major potion of health.
Here, have a major flask of health.
Here, have a bonemeal potion from Lodar.
Here, have this nice potion. [give her a poison potion]

message: That didn't work. My wounds are too deep.

replies.text: Oh dear, wait, I'll get something different.

message: Ahh, that's good. Thank you, kid ... $playername.
[Spits] What is this stuff?! Throw it away before you drink it yourself. It's rotten.
You hope that she doesn't notice your guilty conscience.
Now don't just stand around here. Look lively and find Luthor's ring.

replies.text: Ah, you're back to your old self already.

message: Suits me, this place. Don't you think?
Royal, yes.
In fact, I am King Luthor's heir. He's my ancestor.
How else would I be able to wear his gloves without getting hurt?
Nothing to be proud of though. Forget it, child. I should have kept quiet about it.
Of course I'll help you. What are you looking for?

replies.text: Luthor's ring, of course. I just can't find it.

message: Ah - you are looking for this ring here, am I right?

replies.text: What? And I've been searching here for hours!

message: Well, you were so engrossed in the matter that I didn't want to disturb you.
There, catch it! Keep it safe and bring it to Talion. I'm off.
A light breeze remained where Seraphina had just been sitting.
You enter the Thieves' Guild looking for things to do.

replies.text: I am sure that there is another job for me today.

message: Happy and expectant, you move on.
Oh, that lovely spell! The Striking Spectacle Shadow spell!
One of my specials! Just had an opportunity to use it again recently. Went awesome!

replies.text: Why did you do that? People can get hurt?

message: Nonsense! How can being more noticeable hurt? It's makes one stand out more, makes one more popular.

replies.text: Not if you want to be a thief or similar.

message: Why would these so-called thieves approach you?

replies.text: I'm a kid. No one notices me ...

message: That's debatable in your case, but I see the point.

replies.text: Thanks! So, why did you do it?

message: Because of the gold! Why else?
Of course I use it for the church ...

replies.text: Well, what will it take to remove the spell?

message: Around 50000 coins, of which a large portion will go back to the mysterious Lady Dameni, who had me do the spell. I would need to pacify her, else her toughs will kill me.

replies.text: 50000 coins! Hope the guild can reimburse me.

message: Also I need a few more items ...
Indeed? We'll see. I need the following things:
Oh, just a few little things, easy to get.
Villain's ring, Troublemaker's ring, ring of backstabbing, Tears of the Shadow potion. And most important, Luthor's ring. Together with 50000 gold.

replies.text: You don't ask for much! Where do I find all that?
I don't have Troublemaker's ring yet.
I don't have the ring of backstabbing yet.
I don't have the Villain's ring yet.
I don't have the Tears of the Shadow yet.
I don't have Luthor's ring yet.
I don't have the 50000 pieces of gold yet.
I have everthing besides Luthor's ring
Here's all you have asked for.

message: Well, then go and find it.
By the way, don't come to me with polished rings. The counterspell works with the unmeddled ones only. Hurry now!
Good, that's a start.

replies.text: Now I am going to find Luthor's ring.

message: Check with your thief friends, they should know. All these rings form part of your thievery business.
Yes, this ring might be a little harder to find. I trust in you.

replies.text: Don't you have any idea where it could be?

message: No. Ask your thief friends.
I said no. Go now, child.
I don't know anybody with that name. Sorry.
Did you find the things I asked? Especially Luthor's Ring?

replies.text: That is hard to get. No one knows where it is.

message: Good thieves don't have to search for the things they want. They know where they are.

replies.text: Can't you cast the counterspell without the ring?

message: No ring - no help, sorry.
Find it or your friends may have to retire or go into another honest business. He he!
Behold - Luthor's ring! And this much gold! I hadn't expected that you would manage so soon.
[muttering] With all that gold and rings I could start a new and wealthy life in Nor City. Hmm ...

replies.text: You know that I can hear you?

message: Eh, well. Now it's time to keep my promise and dispell your friends.
[muttering strange words]
[muttering more strange words]
[muttering even more strange words]
Done. Go back to your friends, everything is like before again.
What are you talking about?

replies.text: The rings. I need them back of course.

message: Oh no, you don't. And it's not possible.
I said you don't need the rings. Also it's not possible ...

replies.text: OK, it was just a question. Bye.

message: [Hasty] Now here is Luthor's ring. It is the only one that was powerfull enough to survive the spell. The others are broken.
[to himself] I hope.
Eh, what? Better ask Yolgen.
You must be confusing me.
I don't understand ... What are you talking about?
